comments:
If you run a program (like self hosting Eclipse), close the debugger window it 
was running in and then restart you get a widget is disposed exception.

Steps
1) Select the Open New Perspective in New Window option in your preferences
2) Run Eclipse using self hosting. A debug window will open.
3) Close the self hosted Eclipse.
4) Close the debugger window.
5) Restart using the debug dropdown button in the Java Perspective.

Please note that this workspace has been around for over a month. I am going to 
try with a fresh workspace.

I am not having much luck reproducing this one (even with the great test 
case!!).  Tod, to you still have this problem.

I have changed to using the latest version of the PDE self hosting and I no 
longer get this - I also tried to replicate with an old workspace and could 
not. A widget is disposed error with tool bars has just been fixed so this 
might have been the same issue. See http://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?
id=7536.

I still get this in build 20020115. The problem seems to be related to the 
preferences you use.

In your Workbench Preferences choose

Open new Perspective in new Window
Replace Perspective should be disabled.
Now do the following

1) Copy the contents of viper/team/tod/prs/7626 to your d: drive
2) Start eclipse
3) From the main toolbar select Run->Workbench[Eclipse]
4) A debugger will open. Close it.
5) Exit the self hosted Eclipse (i.e. the target)
6) Widget is disposed error will occur

I replicated this using the data mentioned above.

Problem was with the design of the ShowBreakpointsForModelAction.
Reworked on how it listens for selection in the LaunchView and filters.
